title.narrative: 2.2. ADOLESCENTS HEALTH

description.narrative: By 2021, integrated care models for health and nutrition for adolescents will have been adapted and implemented for the priority territories., which contributes to Adolescents And Hiv/Aids, Early Detection And Treatment Of Malnutrition, Fast-Track The End Of Hiv/Aids, Health And Development In Early Childhood And Adolescence, Health Systems Strengthening, Health â€“ General, Immunization Services As Part Of Primary Health Care, Maternal And Newborn Health, Mental Health And Psychosocial Well-Being, Nutrition In Early Childhood, Nutrition Of Adolescents And Women, Nutrition â€“ General, Strengthening Primary Health Care And High-Impact Health Interventions, Strengthening Primary Health Care And High-Impact Health Interventions (Covid). UNICEF aims to achieve this through Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2021, the adolescent population will have improved opportunities to live a healthy life, learn throughout their life and fully exercise their citizenship

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By 2021, integrated care models for health and nutrition for adolescents will have been adapted and implemented for the priorityterritories.

description.narrative: UNICEF’s assistance contributed to improve adolescents’ access to quality health services in pandemic and non-pandemic contexts reaching 65,920 adolescents. Technical assistance was provided to formulate ;normative and planning documents to reactivate health services during the COVID-19 and boost mental health services for adolescents through innovative approaches (209 community services and online helpline). A specialization in-service training programme in Comprehensive Adolescent Health Care was implemented and institutionalized by the National School of Public Health, while several strategies to strengthen adolescent health care in community settings were successfully piloted. | Status:Met | As-of Date:17/12/2021

baseline.value: National: 10,143,286 soles; Lima: 589,563 soles; Huancavelica: 113,208 soles; Loreto: 641,878 soles; Ucayali: 121,100 soles

actual.value: 2021:The budget is 3% higher than in 2015, with the exception of Loreto where there was a significant reduction. National: 32,288,758 soles (218% increase), Lima: 1,675,209 soles (184% increase), Huancavelica: 1'013,089 soles (795% increase), Loreto: 308,618 s
